appendix.title: Function Reference
appendix.para: This appendix provides a list of all the functions which are currently defined in Gnumeric.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: BITAND returns the bitwise and of the binary representations of its arguments.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: BITLSHIFT returns the binary representations of a shifted n positions to the left.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: BITOR returns the bitwise or of the binary representations of its arguments.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: BITRSHIFT returns the binary representations of a shifted n positions to the right.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: BITXOR returns the bitwise exclusive or of the binary representations of its arguments.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: IMARCCOS returns the complex arccosine of the complex number z. The branch cuts are on the real axis, less than -1 and greater than 1.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: IMARCCOSH returns the complex hyperbolic arccosine of the complex number z. The branch cut is on the real axis, less than 1.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: IMARCSIN returns the complex arcsine of the complex number z. The branch cuts are on the real axis, less than -1 and greater than 1.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: IMARCSINH returns the complex hyperbolic arcsine of the complex number z. The branch cuts are on the imaginary axis, below -i and above i.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: IMARCTAN returns the complex arctangent of the complex number z. The branch cuts are on the imaginary axis, below -i and above i.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: IMARCTANH returns the complex hyperbolic arctangent of the complex number z. The branch cuts are on the real axis, less than -1 and greater than 1.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The argument theta of a complex number is its angle in radians from the real axis.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The result will have an imaginary part between -π and +π.
The natural logarithm is not uniquely defined on complex numbers. You may need to add or subtract an even multiple of π to the imaginary part.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: database is a range in which rows of related information are records and columns of data are fields. The first row of a database contains labels for each column.
database: a range in which rows of related information are records and columns of data are fields
field: a string or integer specifying which field is to be used

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: field is a string or integer specifying whichfield is to be used. If field is an integer nthen the nth column will be used. If field is a string, then the column with the matching label will be used.
database: a range in which rows of related information are records and columns of data are fields
field: a string or integer specifying which field is to be used

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: criteria is a range containing conditions. The first row of a criteria should contain labels. Each label specifies to which field the conditions given in that column apply. Each cell below the label specifies a condition such as ">3" or "<9". An equality condition can be given by simply specifying a value, e. g. "3" or "Jody". For a record to be considered it must satisfy all conditions in at least one of the rows of criteria.
database: a range in which rows of related information are records and columns of data are fields
field: a string or integer specifying which field is to be used

field: a string or integer specifying which field is to be used

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The DATE function creates date serial values. 1-Jan-1900 is serial value 1, 2-Jan-1900 is serial value 2, and so on. For compatibility reasons, a serial value is reserved for the non-existing date 29-Feb-1900.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The DATE2UNIX function translates a date serial values into a Unix timestamp.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: DATEDIF returns the distance from start_date to end_date according to the unit specified by interval.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: DATEVALUE returns the date serial value part of a date and time serial value.
serial: date and time serial value

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The DAY function returns the day-of-month part of date.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: DAYS360 returns the number of days from start_date to end_date.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: EDATE returns date moved forward or backward the number of months specified by months.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: EOMONTH returns the date serial value of the end of the month specified by date adjusted forward or backward the number of months specified by months.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The HOUR function computes the hour part of the fractional day given by time.
time: time of day as fractional day.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: ISOWEEKNUM calculates the week number according to the ISE 8601 standard. Weeks start on Mondays and week 1 contains the first Thursday of the year.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: ISOYEAR calculates the year to go with week number according to the ISE 8601 standard.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The MINUTE function computes the minute part of the fractional day given by time.
time: time of day as fractional day.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The MONTH function returns the month part of date.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: NETWORKDAYS calculates the number of days from start_date to end_date skipping weekends and holidays in the process.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The NOW function returns the date and time serial value of the moment it is computed. Recomputing later will produce a different value.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The SECOND function computes the seconds part of the fractional day given by time.
time: time of day as fractional day.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The TIME function computes the fractional day between midnight at the time given by hour, minute, and second.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: TIMEVALUE returns the time-of-day part of a date and time serial value.
serial: date and time serial value

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The TODAY function returns the date serial value of the day it is computed. Recomputing on a later date will produce a different value.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The UNIT2DATE function translates Unix timestamps into date serial values. Unix timestamps are number of seconds since Midnight 1-Jan-1900.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The WEEKDAY function returns the day-of-week of date. The value of method determines how days are numbered.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: WEEKNUM calculates the week number according to method which defaults to 1.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: WORKDAY adjusts date by days skipping over weekends and holidays in the process.
days: number of days to add

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The YEAR function returns the year part of date.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: YEARFRAC calculates the number of days from start_date to end_date according to the calendar specified by basis, which defaults to 0, and expresses the result as a fractional number of years.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: BASE converts n to its string representation in base b. Leading zeroes will be added to reach the minimum length given by length.
length: minimum length of the resutling string

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: If places is given, BIN2HEX pads the result with zeros to achieve exactly places digits. If this is not possible, BIN2HEX returns #NUM!
x: a binary number, either as a string or as a number involving only the digits 0 and 1

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: If places is given, BIN2OCT pads the result with zeros to achieve exactly places digits. If this is not possible, BIN2OCT returns #NUM!
x: a binary number, either as a string or as a number involving only the digits 0 and 1

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: CONVERT returns a conversion from one measurement system to another. x is a value in from units that is to be converted into to units.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: from and to can be any of the following:
For metric units any of the following prefixes can be used:

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: If places is given, DEC2BIN pads the result with zeros to achieve exactly places digits. If this is not possible, DEC2BIN returns #NUM!

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: If places is given, DEC2HEX pads the result with zeros to achieve exactly places digits. If this is not possible, DEC2HEX returns #NUM!

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: If places is given, DEC2OCT pads the result with zeros to achieve exactly places digits. If this is not possible, DEC2OCT returns #NUM!

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: DELTA returns 1 if x1 = x0 and 0 otherwise.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: ERF returns 2/sqrt(π)* integral from lower to upper of exp(-t*t) dt
lower: lower limit of the integral, defaults to 0
upper: upper limit of the integral

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: ERFC returns 2/sqrt(π)* integral from x to ∞ of exp(-t*t) dt

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: GESTEP returns 1 if x1 ≤ x0 and 0 otherwise.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: If places is given, HEX2BIN pads the result with zeros to achieve exactly places digits. If this is not possible, HEX2BIN returns #NUM!
x: a hexadecimal number, either as a string or as a number if no A to F are needed

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: If places is given, HEX2OCT pads the result with zeros to achieve exactly places digits. If this is not possible, HEX2OCT returns #NUM!
x: a hexadecimal number, either as a string or as a number if no A to F are needed

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: INVSUMINV sum calculates the reciprocal (the inverse) of the sum of reciprovals (inverses) of all its arguments.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: If places is given, OCT2BIN pads the result with zeros to achieve exactly places digits. If this is not possible, OCT2BIN returns #NUM!
x: a octal number, either as a string or as a number

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: If places is given, OCT2HEX pads the result with zeros to achieve exactly places digits. If this is not possible, OCT2HEX returns #NUM!
x: a octal number, either as a string or as a number

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: DIMCIRC returns the number of circuits required given traffic calls with grade of service gos.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: OFFCAP returns the traffic capacity given circuits circuits with grade of service gos.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: OFFTRAF returns the predicted number of offered calls given traffic carried calls (taken from measurements) on circuits circuits.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: PROBBLOCK returns probability of blocking when traffic calls load into ccicuits circuits.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: ACCRINT calculates the accrued interest for a security that pays periodic interest.
first_interest: date of first interest payment
frequency: number of interest payments per year

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: ACCRINT calculates the accrued interest from issue to maturity.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: AMORDEGRC calculates the depreciation of an asset using French accounting conventions. Assets purchased in the middle of a period take prorated depreciation into account. This is similar to AMORLINC, except that a depreciation coefficient is applied in the calculation depending on the life of the assets.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: AMORLINC calculates the depreciation of an asset using French accounting conventions. Assets purchased in the middle of a period take prorated depreciation into account.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: COUPDAYBS calculates the number of days from the beginning of the coupon period to the settlement date.
frequency: number of interest payments per year

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: COUPDAYS calculates the number of days in the coupon period of the settlement date.
frequency: number of interest payments per year

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: COUPDAYSNC calculates number of days from the settlement date to the next coupon period.
frequency: number of interest payments per year

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: COUPNCD calculates the coupon date following settlement.
frequency: number of interest payments per year

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: COUPNUM calculates the number of coupons to be paid between the settlement and maturity dates, rounded up.
frequency: number of interest payments per year

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: COUPPCD calculates the coupon date preceeding settlement.
frequency: number of interest payments per year

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: CUM_BIV_NORM_DIST calculates the probability that two standard normal distributed random variables with correlation rho are respectively each less than a and b.
a: limit for first random variable
b: limit for second random variable
rho: correlation of the two random variables

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: CUMIPMT calculates the cumulative interest paid on a loan from start_period to end_period.
start_period: first period to accumulate for
end_period: last period to accumulate for

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: CUMPRINC calculates the cumulative principal paid on a loan from start_period to end_period.
start_period: first period to accumulate for
end_period: last period to accumulate for

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: DB calculates the depreciation of an asset for a given period using the fixed-declining balance method.
month: number of months in first year of depreciation

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: DDB calculates the depreciation of an asset for a given period using the double-declining balance method.
factor: factor at which the balance declines

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: DISC calculates the discount rate for a security.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: DOLLARDE converts a fractional dollar amount into a decimal amount. This is the inverse of the DOLLARFR function.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: DOLLARFR converts a fractional dollar amount into a fraction which is represented as the digits after the decimal point. For example, 2/8 would be represented as .2 while 3/16 would be represented as .03.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: DURATION calculates the duration of a security.
frequency: number of interest payments per year

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: EFFECT calculates the effective interest rate using the formula (1+rate/nper)^nper-1.
nper: number of periods used for compounding

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: EURO calculates the national currency amount corresponding to 1 EUR for any of the national currencies that were replaced by the Euro on its introduction.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: EUROCONVERT converts n units of currency source to currency target. The rates used are the official ones used on the introduction of the Euro.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: FV calculates the future value of pv moved nper periods into the future, assuming a periodic payment of pmt and an interest rate of rate per period.
rate: effective interest rate per period

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: FVSCHEDULE calculates the future value of principal after applying a range of interest rates with compounding.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: G_DURATION calculates the number of periods needed for an investment to attain a desired value.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: INTRATE calculates the interest of a fully vested security.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: IPMT calculates the interest part of an annuity's payment for period number per.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: IRR calculates the internal rate of return of a cash flow with periodic payments. values lists the payments (negative values) and receipts (positive values) for each period.
guess: an estimate of what the result should be

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: ISPMT calculates the interest payment for period number per.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: MDURATION calculates the Macauley duration of a security.
frequency: number of interest payments per year

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: MIRR calculates the modified internal rate of return of a periodic cash flow.
finance_rate: interest rate for financing cost

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: NOMINAL calculates the nominal interest rate from the effective rate.
nper: number of periods used for compounding

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: NPER calculates the number of periods of an investment based on periodic constant payments and a constant interest rate.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: NPV calculates the net present value of a cash flow.
rate: effective interest rate per period

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: ODDFPRICE calculates the price per $100 face value of a security that pays periodic interest, but has an odd first period.
frequency: number of interest payments per year

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: ODDFYIELD calculates the yield of a security that pays periodic interest, but has an odd first period.
frequency: number of interest payments per year

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: ODDLPRICE calculates the price per $100 face value of a security that pays periodic interest, but has an odd last period.
frequency: number of interest payments per year

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: ODDLYIELD calculates the yield of a security that pays periodic interest, but has an odd last period.
frequency: number of interest payments per year

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: OPT_2_ASSET_CORRELATION models the theoretical price of options on 2 assets with correlation rho. The payoff for a call is max(spot2 - strike2,0) if spot1 > strike1 or 0 otherwise. The payoff for a put is max (strike2 - spot2, 0) if spot1 < strike1 or 0 otherwise.
call_put_flag: 'c' for a call and 'p' for a put
spot1: spot price of the underlying asset of the first option
spot2: spot price of the underlying asset of the second option
strike1: strike prices of the first option
strike1: strike prices of the second option
time: time to maturity in years
cost_of_carry1: net cost of holding the underlying asset of the first option (for common stocks, the risk free rate less the dividend yield)
cost_of_carry2: net cost of holding the underlying asset of the second option (for common stocks, the risk free rate less the dividend yield)
volatility1: annualized volatility in price of the underlying asset of the first option
volatility2: annualized volatility in price of the underlying asset of the second option
rho: correlation between the two underlying assets

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: OPT_AMER_EXCHANGE models the theoretical price of an American option to exchange one asset with quantity qty2 and spot price spot2 for another with quantity qty1 and spot price spot1.
time: time to maturity in years
cost_of_carry1: net cost of holding asset 1 (for common stocks, the risk free rate less the dividend yield)
cost_of_carry2: net cost of holding asset 2 (for common stocks, the risk free rate less the dividend yield)
volatility1: annualized volatility in price of asset 1
volatility2: annualized volatility in price of asset 2
rho: correlation between the prices of the two assets

refsect1.title: See also
refsect1.para: OPT_EURO_EXCHANGE, OPT_BS, OPT_BS_DELTA, OPT_BS_RHO, OPT_BS_THETA, OPT_BS_GAMMA.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: OPT_BS uses the Black-Scholes model to calculate the price of a European option struck at strike on an asset with spot price spot.
call_put_flag: 'c' for a call and 'p' for a put
time: time to maturity in years
rate: risk-free interest rate to the exercise date in percent
volatility: annualized volatility of the asset in percent for the period through to the exercise date
cost_of_carry: net cost of holding the underlying asset (for common stocks, the risk free rate less the dividend yield), defaults to 0

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: OPT_BS_CARRYCOST uses the Black-Scholes model to calculate the 'elasticity' of a European option struck at strike on an asset with spot price spot. The elasticity of an option is the rate of change of its price with respect to its cost_of_carry.
call_put_flag: 'c' for a call and 'p' for a put
time: time to maturity in years
rate: risk-free interest rate to the exercise date in percent
volatility: annualized volatility of the asset in percent for the period through to the exercise date
cost_of_carry: net cost of holding the underlying asset (for common stocks, the risk free rate less the dividend yield), defaults to 0

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: call_put_flag: 'c' for a call and 'p' for a put
time: time to maturity in years
rate: risk-free interest rate to the exercise date in percent
volatility: annualized volatility of the asset in percent for the period through to the exercise date
cost_of_carry: net cost of holding the underlying asset (for common stocks, the risk free rate less the dividend yield), defaults to 0

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: OPT_BS_DELTA uses the Black-Scholes model to calculate the 'delta' of a European option struck at strike on an asset with spot price spot.
call_put_flag: 'c' for a call and 'p' for a put
time: time to maturity in years
rate: risk-free interest rate to the exercise date in percent
volatility: annualized volatility of the asset in percent for the period through to the exercise date
cost_of_carry: net cost of holding the underlying asset (for common stocks, the risk free rate less the dividend yield), defaults to 0

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: OPT_BS_DELTA uses the Black-Scholes model to calculate the 'gamma' of a European option struck at strike on an asset with spot price spot. The gamma of an option is the second derivative of its price with respect to the price of the underlying asset.
time: time to maturity in years
rate: risk-free interest rate to the exercise date in percent
volatility: annualized volatility of the asset in percent for the period through to the exercise date
cost_of_carry: net cost of holding the underlying asset (for common stocks, the risk free rate less the dividend yield), defaults to 0

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: OPT_BS_DELTA uses the Black-Scholes model to calculate the 'rho' of a European option struck at strike on an asset with spot price spot. The rho of an option is the rate of change of its price with respect to the risk free interest rate.
call_put_flag: 'c' for a call and 'p' for a put
time: time to maturity in years
rate: risk-free interest rate to the exercise date in percent
volatility: annualized volatility of the asset in percent for the period through to the exercise date
cost_of_carry: net cost of holding the underlying asset (for common stocks, the risk free rate less the dividend yield), defaults to 0

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: OPT_BS_DELTA uses the Black-Scholes model to calculate the 'theta' of a European option struck at strike on an asset with spot price spot. The theta of an option is the rate of change of its price with respect to time to expiry.
call_put_flag: 'c' for a call and 'p' for a put
time: time to maturity in years
rate: risk-free interest rate to the exercise date in percent
volatility: annualized volatility of the asset in percent for the period through to the exercise date
cost_of_carry: net cost of holding the underlying asset (for common stocks, the risk free rate less the dividend yield), defaults to 0

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: OPT_BS_DELTA uses the Black-Scholes model to calculate the 'vega' of a European option struck at strike on an asset with spot price spot. The vega of an option is the rate of change of its price with respect to volatility.
time: time to maturity in years
rate: risk-free interest rate to the exercise date in percent
volatility: annualized volatility of the asset in percent for the period through to the exercise date
cost_of_carry: net cost of holding the underlying asset (for common stocks, the risk free rate less the dividend yield), defaults to 0

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: OPT_EURO_EXCHANGE models the theoretical price of a European option to exchange one asset with quantity qty2 and spot price spot2 for another with quantity qty1 and spot price spot1.
time: time to maturity in years
cost_of_carry1: net cost of holding asset 1 (for common stocks, the risk free rate less the dividend yield)
cost_of_carry2: net cost of holding asset 2 (for common stocks, the risk free rate less the dividend yield)
volatility1: annualized volatility in price of asset 1
volatility2: annualized volatility in price of asset 2
rho: correlation between the prices of the two assets

refsect1.title: See also
refsect1.para: OPT_AMER_EXCHANGE, OPT_BS, OPT_BS_DELTA, OPT_BS_RHO, OPT_BS_THETA, OPT_BS_GAMMA.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: OPT_EXTENDIBLE_WRITER models the theoretical price of extendible writer options. These are options that have their maturity extended to time2 if the option is out of the money at time1.
call_put_flag: 'c' for a call and 'p' for a put
strike1: strike price at which the option is struck
strike2: strike price at which the option is re-struck if out of the money at time1
time1: initial maturity of the option in years
time2: extended maturity in years if chosen
cost_of_carry: net cost of holding the underlying asset
volatility: annualized volatility of the asset

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: OPT_FIXED_STRK_LKBK determines the theoretical price of a fixed-strike lookback option where the holder of the option may exercise on expiry at the most favourable price observed during the options life of the underlying asset.
call_put_flag: 'c' for a call and 'p' for a put
spot_min: minimum spot price of the underlying asset so far observed
spot_max: maximum spot price of the underlying asset so far observed
time: time to maturity in years
cost_of_carry: net cost of holding the underlying asset
volatility: annualized volatility of the asset

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: OPT_FLOAT_STRK_LKBK determines the theoretical price of a floating-strike lookback option where the holder of the option may exercise on expiry at the most favourable price observed during the options life of the underlying asset.
call_put_flag: 'c' for a call and 'p' for a put
spot_min: minimum spot price of the underlying asset so far observed
spot_max: maximum spot price of the underlying asset so far observed
time: time to maturity in years
cost_of_carry: net cost of holding the underlying asset
volatility: annualized volatility of the asset

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: OPT_FRENCH values the theoretical price of a European option adjusted for trading day volatility, struck at strike on an asset with spot price spot.
call_put_flag: 'c' for a call and 'p' for a put
time: ratio of the number of calendar days to exercise and the number of calendar days in the year
ttime: ratio of the number of trading days to exercise and the number of trading days in the year
rate: risk-free interest rate to the exercise date in percent
volatility: annualized volatility of the asset in percent for the period through to the exercise date
cost_of_carry: net cost of holding the underlying asset (for common stocks, the risk free rate less the dividend yield), defaults to 0

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: OPT_GARMAN_KOHLHAGEN values the theoretical price of a European currency option struck at strike on an asset with spot price spot.
call_put_flag: 'c' for a call and 'p' for a put
time: number of days to exercise
domestic_rate: domestic risk-free interest rate to the exercise date in percent
foreign_rate: foreign risk-free interest rate to the exercise date in percent
volatility: annualized volatility of the asset in percent for the period through to the exercise date

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: OPT_JUMP_DIFF models the theoretical price of an option according to the Jump Diffusion process (Merton).
call_put_flag: 'c' for a call and 'p' for a put
time: time to maturity in years
rate: the annualized rate of interest
volatility: annualized volatility of the asset in percent for the period through to the exercise date
lambda: expected number of 'jumps' per year
gamma: proportion of volatility explained by the 'jumps'

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: OPT_TIME_SWITCH models the theoretical price of time switch options. (Pechtl 1995). The holder receives a * dt for each period that the asset price was greater than strike (for a call) or below it (for a put).
call_put_flag: 'c' for a call and 'p' for a put
a: amount received for each time period
time: time to maturity in years
m: number of time units the option has already met the condition
dt: agreed upon discrete time period expressed as a fraction of a year
cost_of_carry: net cost of holding the underlying asset
volatility: annualized volatility of the asset

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: PMT calculates the payment amount for an annuity.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: PPMT calculates the principal part of an annuity's payment for period number per.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: PRICE calculates the price per $100 face value of a security that pays periodic interest.
frequency: number of interest payments per year

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: PRICEDISC calculates the price per $100 face value of a bond that does not pay interest at maturity.
discount: annual rate at which to discount

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: PRICEMAT calculates the price per $100 face value of a bond that pays interest at maturity.
discount: annual rate at which to discount

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: PV calculates the present value of fv which is nper periods into the future, assuming a periodic payment of pmt and an interest rate of rate per period.
rate: effective interest rate per period

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: RATE calculates the rate of return.
guess: an estimate of what the result should be

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: RECEIVED calculates the amount to be received when a security matures.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: SLN calculates the depreciation of an asset using the straight-line method.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: SYD calculates the depreciation of an asset using the sum-of-years method.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: TBILLEQ calculates the bond-equivalent yield for a treasury bill.
discount: annual rate at which to discount

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: TBILLPRICE calculates the price per $100 face value for a treasury bill.
discount: annual rate at which to discount

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: TBILLYIELD calculates the yield of a treasury bill.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: VDB calculates the depreciation of an asset for a given period range using the double-declining balance method.
start_period: first period to accumulate for
end_period: last period to accumulate for
factor: factor at which the balance declines
no_switch: do not switch to straight-line depreciation

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: XIRR calculates the annualized internal rate of return of a cash flow at arbitrary points in time. values lists the payments (negative values) and receipts (positive values) with one value for each entry in dates.
guess: an estimate of what the result should be

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: XNPV calculates the net present value of a cash flow at irregular times

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: YIELD calculates the yield of a security that pays periodic interest.
frequency: number of interest payments per year

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: YIELDDISC calculates the yield of a discounted security.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: YIELDMAT calculates the yield of a security for which the interest is paid at maturity date.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: GNUMERIC_VERSION returns the version of gnumeric as a string.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: type specifies the type of information you want to obtain:
address Returns the given cell reference as text.
col Returns the number of the column in cell.
contents Returns the contents of the cell in cell.
column Returns the number of the column in cell.
coord Returns the absolute address of cell.
filename Returns the name of the file of cell.
format Returns the code of the format of the cell.
locked Returns 1 if cell is locked.
parentheses Returns 1 if cell contains a negative value
and its format displays it with parentheses.
prefix Returns a character indicating the horizontal
protect Returns 1 if cell is locked.
row Returns the number of the row in cell.
sheetname Returns the name of the sheet of cell.
type Returns "l" if cell contains a string,
"v" if it contains some other value, and
value Returns the contents of the cell in cell.
type: string specifying the type of information requested

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: ERROR.TYPE returns an error number corresponding to the given error value. The error numbers for error values are:

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: INFO returns information about the current operating environment according to type:
memavail Returns the amount of memory available, bytes.
memused Returns the amount of memory used (bytes).
numfile Returns the number of active worksheets.
osversion Returns the operating system version.
release Returns the version of Gnumeric as text.
system Returns the name of the environment.
totmem Returns the amount of total memory available.
type: string giving the type of information requested

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: TYPE returns a number indicating the data type of @{ value}:

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: AND calculates the logical conjunction of its arguments b0,b1,...

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: This function first evaluates the condition. If the result is true, it will then evaluate and return the second argument. Otherwise, it will evaluate and return the last argument.
trueval: value to use if condition is true.
falseval: value to use if condition is false.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: This function returns the first value, unless that is an error, in which case it returns the second.
x: value to test for error.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: NOT calculates the logical negation of its argument.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: OR calculates the logical disjunction of its arguments b0,b1,...

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: XOR calculates the logical exclusive disjunction of its arguments b0,b1,...

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: COLUMN function returns a Nx1 array containing the sequence of integers from the first column to the last column of reference.
x: reference, defaults to the position of the current expression

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: HLOOKUP function finds the row in range that has a first cell similar to value. If approximate is not true it finds the row with an exact equality. If approximate is true, it finds the last row with first value less than or equal tovalue. If as_index is true the 0-based row offset is returned.
row: 1-based column offset indicating the return values
approximate: if false, an exact match of value must be found; defaults to FALSE
as_index: if true, the 0-based row offset is returned; defaults to FALSE

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: HYPERLINK function currently returns its 2nd argument, or if that is omitted the 1st argument.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: INDEX gives a reference to a cell in the given array. The cell is selected by row and col, which count the rows and columns in the array.
area: from which area to select a cell, defaults to 1

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: If vector1 has more rows than columns, LOOKUP searches the first row of vector1, otherwise the first column. If vector2 is omitted the return value is taken from the last row or column of vector1.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: MATCH searches vector for seek and returns the 1-based index.
vector: n by 1 or 1 by n range to be searched
type: +1 to find the largest value ≤ seek, 0 to find the first value = seek, or-1 to find the smallest value ≥ seek

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: OFFSET returns the cell range starting at offset (row,col) from range of height height and width width.
row: number of rows to offset range
col: number of columns to offset range
height: height of the offset range, defaults to height of range
width: width of the offset range, defaults to width of range

refsect1.title: See also
refsect1.para: COLUMN, COLUMNS, ROWS, INDEX, INDIRECT, ADDRESS.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: ROW function returns a 1xN array containing the sequence of integers from the first row to the last row of reference.
x: reference, defaults to the position of the current expression

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: VLOOKUP function finds the row in range that has a first cell similar to value. If approximate is not true it finds the row with an exact equality. If approximate is true, it finds the last row with first value less than or equal to value. If as_index is true the 0-based row offset is returned.
column: 1-based column offset indicating the return values
approximate: if false, an exact match of value must be found; defaults to FALSE
as_index: if true, the 0-based row offset is returned; defaults to FALSE

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: ABS gives the absolute value of x, i.e. the non-negative number of the same magnitude as x.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: ASIN calculates the arc sine of x; that is the value whose sine is x.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: ASINH calculates the inverse hyperbolic sine of x; that is the value whose hyperbolic sine is x.

refsect1.title: See also
refsect1.para: ASIN, ACOSH, SIN, COS, DEGREES, RADIANS.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: ATAN calculates the arc tangent of x; that is the value whose tangent is x.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: ATAN2 calculates the arc tangent of the ratio b1/b2 with the sign according to the quadrant containing (b1,b2).

refsect1.title: See also
refsect1.para: ATAN, ATANH, COS, SIN, DEGREES, RADIANS.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: ATANH calculates the inverse hyperbolic tangent of x; that is the value whose hyperbolic tangent is x.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: BETA function returns the value of the Euler beta function extended to all real numbers except 0 and negative integers.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: BETALN function returns the natural logarithm of the absolute value of the Euler beta function extended to all real numbers except 0 and negative integers.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: CEIL(x) is the smallest integer that is at least as large as x.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: CEILING(x,significance) is the nearest multiple of significance whose absolute value is at least ABS(x).
significance: base multiple (defaults to 1 for x > 0 and -1 for x <0)

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: COMBIN returns the binomial coefficient "n choose k"

refsect1.title: See also
refsect1.para: SIN, TAN, SINH, COSH, TANH, RADIANS, DEGREES.

refsect1.title: See also
refsect1.para: SIN, TAN, SINH, COSH, TANH, RADIANS, DEGREES.

refsect1.title: See also
refsect1.para: SIN, COS, TAN, SEC, SINH, COSH, TANH, RADIANS, DEGREES.

refsect1.title: See also
refsect1.para: SIN, COS, TAN, CSC, SEC, SINH, COSH, TANH, RADIANS, DEGREES.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: FACTDOUBLE function returns the double factorial x!!

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: FIB(n) is the nth Fibonacci number.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: FLOOR(x,significance) is the nearest multiple of significance whose absolute value is at most ABS(x)
significance: base multiple (defaults to 1 for x > 0 and -1 for x <0)

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: GCD calculates the greatest common divisor of the given numbers n0,n1,..., the greatest integer that is a divisor of each argument.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: LCM calculates the least common multiple of the given numbers n0,n1,..., the smallest integer that is a multiple of each argment.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: LN1P calculates LN(1+x) but yielding a higher precision than evaluating LN(1+x).

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: MOD function returns the remainder when x is divided by n.

refsect1.title: See also
refsect1.para: CEIL, CEILING, FLOOR, ABS, INT, ABS.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Product computes the product of all the values and cells referenced in the argument list.
values: a list of values to multiply

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: QUOTIENT yields the integer portion of the division numerator/denominator.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: ROMAN returns the arabic number n as a roman numeral text.
If type is 0 or it is omitted, ROMAN returns classic roman numbers.
Type 1 is more concise than classic type, type 2 is more concise than type 1, and type 3 is more concise than type 2. Type 4 is a simplified type.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: If d is greater than zero, x is rounded to the given number of digits.
If d is zero, x is rounded to the next integer.
If d is less than zero, x is rounded to the left of the decimal point

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: If d is greater than zero, x is rounded toward 0 to the given number of digits.
If d is zero, x is rounded toward 0 to the next integer.
If d is less than zero, x is rounded toward 0 to the left of the decimal point

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: If d is greater than zero, x is rounded away from 0 to the given number of digits.
If d is zero, x is rounded away from 0 to the next integer.
If d is less than zero, x is rounded away from 0 to the left of the decimal point

refsect1.title: See also
refsect1.para: SIN, COS, TAN, CSC, SINH, COSH, TANH, RADIANS, DEGREES.

refsect1.title: See also
refsect1.para: SIN, COS, TAN, CSC, SEC, SINH, COSH, TANH, RADIANS, DEGREES.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: SIGN returns 1 if the x is positive and it returns -1 if x is negative.

refsect1.title: See also
refsect1.para: COS, TAN, CSC, SEC, SINH, COSH, TANH, RADIANS, DEGREES.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: SUM computes the sum of all the values and cells referenced in the argument list.
values: a list of values to add

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Numbers, text and logical values are included in the calculation too. If the cell contains text or the argument evaluates to FALSE, it is counted as value zero (0). If the argument evaluates to TRUE, it is counted as one (1).

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Multiplies corresponding data entries in the given arrays or ranges, and then returns the sum of those products.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: SUMX2MY2 function returns the sum of the difference of squares of corresponding values in two arrays. The equation of SUMX2MY2 is SUM(x^2-y^2).

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: SUMX2PY2 function returns the sum of the sum of squares of corresponding values in two arrays. The equation of SUMX2PY2 is SUM(x^2+y^2).

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: SUMXMY2 function returns the sum of the squares of the differences of corresponding values in two arrays. The equation of SUMXMY2 is SUM((x-y)^2).

refsect1.title: See also
refsect1.para: TANH, COS, COSH, SIN, SINH, DEGREES, RADIANS.

refsect1.title: See also
refsect1.para: TAN, SIN, SINH, COS, COSH, DEGREES, RADIANS.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: ISPRIME returns TRUE if n is prime and FALSE otherwise.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: NT_D calculates the number of divisors of n.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: NT_MU function (Möbius mu function) returns 0 if n is divisible by the square of a prime. Otherwise, if n has an odd number of different prime factors, NT_MU returns -1, and if n has an even number of different prime factors, it returns 1. If n = 1, NT_MU returns 1.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: NT_PI returns the number of primes less than or equal to n.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: NT_SIGMA calculates the sum of the divisors of n.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: PFACTOR finds the smallest prime factor of its argument.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: RANDDISCRETE returns one of the values in the val_range. The probabilities for each value are given in the prob_range.
val_range: possible values of the random variable
prob_range: probabilities of the corresponding values in val_range, defaults to equal probabilities

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: For b = 1 the exponential power distribution reduces to the Laplace distribution.
a: scale parameter of the exponential power distribution
b: exponent of the exponential power distribution

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: For b = 2 the exponential power distribution reduces to the normal distribution with σ = a/sqrt(2)
a: scale parameter of the exponential power distribution
b: exponent of the exponential power distribution

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: For @{α} = 1, @{β}=0, the Lévy distribution reduces to the Cauchy (or Lorentzian) distribution.
c: parameter of the Lévy distribution

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: SIMTABLE returns one of the values in the given argument list depending on the round number of the simulation tool. When the simulation tool is not activated, SIMTABLE returns d1.

With the simulation tool and the SIMTABLE function you can test given decision variables. Each SIMTABLE function contains the possible values of a simulation variable. In most valid simulation models you should have the same number of values dN for all decision variables. If the simulation is run more rounds than there are values defined, SIMTABLE returns #N/A! error (e.g. if A1 contains `=SIMTABLE(1)' and A2 `=SIMTABLE(1,2)', A1 yields #N/A! error on the second round).

The successive use of the simulation tool also requires that you give to the tool at least one input variable having RAND() or any other RAND<distribution name>() function in it. On each round, the simulation tool iterates for the given number of rounds over all the input variables to reevaluate them. On each iteration, the values of the output variables are stored, and when the round is completed, descriptive statistical information is created according to the values.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: If stats is true, the second row contains the corresponding standard errors of the regression coefficients.In this case, the third row contains the R^2 value and the standard error for the predicted value. The fourth row contains the observed F value and its degrees of freedom. Finally, the fifth row contains the regression sum of squares and the residual sum of squares.
@{known_y's}: vector of values of dependent variable.
@{known_x's}: array of values of independent variables, defaults to a single vector 1,...,n.
affine: if true, the model contains a constant term, defaults to true.
stats: if true, some additional statistics are provided, defaults to false

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: LOGEST function applies the ``least squares'' method to fit an exponential curve of the form y = b * m{1}^x{1} * m{2}^x{2}... to your data.
@{known_x's}: known x-values; if known_x's is omitted, an array {1, 2, 3, ...} is used.
const: if this is false the line will be forced to go through (0,1); defaults to TRUE
stat: If stat is TRUE, extra statistical information will be returned; defaults to FALSE.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: @{known_x's}: known x-values; if known_x's is omitted, an array {1, 2, 3, ...} is used.
const: if this is false the line will be forced to go through (0,1); defaults to TRUE
stat: If stat is TRUE, extra statistical information will be returned; defaults to FALSE.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: LOGFIT function applies the ``least squares'' method to fit the logarithmic equationy = a + b * ln(sign * (x - c)) , sign = +1 or -1 to your data. The graph of the equation is a logarithmic curve moved horizontally by c and possibly mirrored across the y-axis (if sign = -1).

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: LOGFIT returns an array having five columns and one row. `Sign' is given in the first column, `a', `b', and `c' are given in columns 2 to 4. Column 5 holds the sum of squared residuals.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: LOGREG function transforms your x's to z=ln(x) and applies the ``least squares'' method to fit the linear equation y = m * z + b to your y's and z's --- equivalent to fitting the equation y = m * ln(x) + b to y's and x's. LOGREG returns an array having two columns and one row. m is given in the first column and b in the second.
@{known_x's}: known x-values; if known_x's is omitted, an array {1, 2, 3, ...} is used.
const: If this is FALSE, the curve will be forced to go through [1; 0], i.e., b will be zero. The default is TRUE.
stat: If stat is TRUE, extra statistical information will be returned; defaults to FALSE.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Any extra statistical information is written below m and b in the result array. This extra statistical information consists of four rows of data: In the first row the standard error values for the coefficients m, b are given. The second row contains the square of R and the standard error for the y estimate. The third row contains the F-observed value and the degrees of freedom. The last row contains the regression sum of squares and the residual sum of squares.The default of stat is FALSE.
@{known_x's}: known x-values; if known_x's is omitted, an array {1, 2, 3, ...} is used.
const: If this is FALSE, the curve will be forced to go through [1; 0], i.e., b will be zero. The default is TRUE.
stat: If stat is TRUE, extra statistical information will be returned; defaults to FALSE.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: CHAR(x) returns the CP1252 (Windows-1252) character with code x.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: x must be in the range 1 to 255.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: CP1252 (Windows-1252) is also known as the "ANSI code page", but it is not an ANSI standard.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: CP1252 (Windows-1252) is based on an early draft of ISO-8859-1, and contains all of its printable characters (but partially at different positions.)

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: c must be a valid CP1252 (Windows-1252) character.

refsect1.para: CP1252 (Windows-1252) is also known as the "ANSI code page", but it is not an ANSI standard.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: CP1252 (Windows-1252) is based on an early draft of ISO-8859-1, and contains all of its printable characters (but partially at different positions.)

refsect1.title: See also
refsect1.para: FIND, LEFTB, RIGHTB, LENB, LEFT, MID, RIGHT, LEN.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: JIS converts half-width katakana and ASCII characters to full-width equivalent characters, copying all others.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The distinction between half-width and full-width characters is described in http://www.unicode.org/reports/tr11/.

refsect1.title: See also
refsect1.para: MID, RIGHT, LEN, MIDB, RIGHTB, LENB.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: search may contain wildcard characters (*) and question marks (?). A question mark matches any single character, and a wildcard matches any string including the empty string. To search for * or ?, precede the symbol with ~.
